Gabriel =
is
> using the name field to store a file name. In JUnit 4 there is no name=

> field.
>  
>     @Parameters
>     public static Collection<Object[]> da=
ta() {
>         return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] { { "file1" }, { "file=
2"
} });

Without the name I'll have to rewrite the tests to a significant
=
degree anyway, but for clarification, the programmers here have a
bunch of =
SQL data files named for the test case they're intended to be
used with.

S=
o for an example test of "testPaymentDAO", the setUp function opens a
conne=
ction to a database, grabs and runs 
"/some/directory/PaymentDAO-setup.sql"=
 to prep the db, the 
"testPaymentDAO" test is run, then in tearDown they g=
rab and run the
correlating tear-down file "/some/directory/PaymentDAO-tear=
Down.sql"
which cleans up after them. 

It seems like this particular test =
suite could be rewritten in a
better way anyway, as apparently they're manu=
al tests requiring
individual user action right now due to complexities unk=
nown to me (it
looks like you need to verify you're logged in as User V and=
 that
table W has Records X with column Y having value Z... before running
=
the tests... *boggle*).
